Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, S.C. 2001, c. 27
Credibility_Assessment: Doubted identity and conversion due to inconsistent testimony and document conditions
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution based on religious conversion
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of applicant and supporting documentation
Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 96-97
Application_Error: Board erred in rejecting identity documents without proof of forgery
Evidence_Ignored: Possibility that document inconsistencies had innocent explanations
Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness applied to Board's decision
Application_Factor: Lack of credible evidence supporting identity and conversion
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board made an unreasonable credibility determination
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections on refugee eligibility and credibility
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credible evidence regarding identity and conversion
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, S.C. 2001, c. 27
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent testimony, condition of documents, absence of corroborating evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Board provided reasons but may have failed to fully consider explanation for document issues
Document_Fraud: Alleged irregularities in identity documents, no proof of forgery established
Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on identity and religious conversion
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged Board's credibility findings as unreasonable
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in judicial review of administrative decisions
Omission_Type: Failure to accept documents without conclusive proof of fraud
